sourceDesc.p: This is the feature-file for the 2nd person plural communis bound pronoun.

revisionDesc.change: For EGY-___ there are no values found
updating references to Zotero IDs via update-bibl-refs.xsl

wib:featureValueObservation.note: Old speakers (60-70) show variation between -kum (2.pl.masc) and -ku (2.pl.comunis), middle age speakers show variation between -ku and -kun, being -ku more frequent, and young speakers show -kun. However, -ku and -kun are 2.pl.comunis, and not 2.pl.masc.

Old speakers (60-70) show variation between -kum (2.pl.masc) and -ku (2.pl.comunis), middle age speakers show variation between -ku and -kun, being -ku more frequent, and young speakers show -kun. However, -ku and -kun are 2.pl.comunis, and not 2.pl.masc.
-ku is used both for 2.pl.masc and 2.pl.fem. but when a negation is attached, the forms -kūš (masc.) - kinniš (fem.) are attested.
